hints.content: Notice that every $4$ units (grid spaces) represents $10\text{ m}$.

We can perform a unit conversion to figure out how many units we need to represent $35\text{ m}$:

$\qquad\begin{align} 
&~~~~35\cancel{\text{ m}} \cdot 
\dfrac{4\text{ units}}{10\cancel{\text{ m}}} \\\\
&=35 \cdot \dfrac{4\text{ units}}{10} \\\\
&=14\text{ units}
\end{align}$

We can do another unit conversion to find how many units we need to represent $40\text{ m}$:

$\qquad\begin{align} 
&~~~~40\cancel{\text{ m}} \cdot 
\dfrac{4\text{ units}}{10\cancel{\text{ m}}} \\\\
&=40\cdot\dfrac{4\text{ units}}{10} \\\\
&=16\text{ units}
\end{align}$
Drag the points to draw a $14\text{-unit}$ by $16\text{-unit}$ rectangle.

question.content:
Kyle looks at a map of his castle and frowns.

(show smallish map on a grid with a certain scale)

"This map is too small!" Kyle complains. "You there! Peasant, draw me a bigger map!"

**Move the points to create a bigger map of Kyle's castle on the grid below.**

(adjust the grid below to show a scale that's 2, 3, 4, or 5 times larger than the scale in the grid above)

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

question.content:
Paulette squints at a map of her city's streets. 

(show map with a scale with "Perseus Park" labeled)

"This map is too small for me to read." she sighs. "I need a bigger map."

**You must help Paulette! Move the points to redraw Perseus Park on the grid below.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

question.content:
Sandy believes that the ideal man's head is $\dfrac{1}{7}$ of his entire height.

**Move the points to draw a head of ideal proportions on the figure below. Represent the head as a square.**

(put an image of a statue in the background)

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

question.content:
"You seem in need of a puzzle to solve!" Kitt exclaims, a grin on his handsome face. "Draw me a square with a quarter of the area of a $12\text{ cm}$ by $12\text{ cm}$ square, and make sure you draw it to scale!"

**Kitt's wish is your command. Draw the square he described by moving the points on the grid below.**

(have the scale on the grid be 3 units to 2 cm)

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

question.content:
Lindsay catches a fish. She then measures the fish and finds its length to be $\dfrac{1}{5}$ of her own height. Lindsay is $150\text{ cm}$ tall.

**Move the points on the grid below to create a segment representing the length of Lindsay's fish.**

(show a scale on the grid below that's 3 grid spaces to 10 cm)

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]
